snippet: Facing growing opposition in Congress, Lawrence H. Summers, the former Treasury secretary and a top contender for Federal Reserve chairman, told President Obama that he didn’t want to be considered for the job.
abstract: Lawrence H Summers, former Treasury secretary and top contender for Federal Reserve chairman, notifies Pres Obama that he does not want to be considered for job; cites growing opposition to his candidacy and Pres Obama's inability to rally Congressional support for strike in Syria, saying neither augured well for his own confirmation in Senate.

byline.original: By ANNIE LOWREY and BINYAMIN APPELBAUM

lead_paragraph: Facing growing opposition in Congress, Lawrence H. Summers, the former Treasury secretary and a top contender for Federal Reserve chairman, told President Obama that he didn’t want to be considered for the job.

headline.main: Summers Pulls Name From Consideration for Fed Chief
headline.print_headline:
Summers Out of Running
For Federal Reserve Chief
